results.content: Very well designed and explained course.
Very relevant, in details and user friendly.
results.content_html: Very relevant, in details and user friendly.

results.content: This is a very detailed and granular tutorial on MS Excel. The basics section though very simple in approach is a must go through as everyone will find something new from there.
results.content_html: This is a very detailed and granular tutorial on MS Excel. The basics section though very simple in approach is a must go through as everyone will find something new from there.

results.content: I am actually quite well versed in Excel but decided to start with the beginners portion of the course for 2 reasons: 1) I could listen along while I work to pick up tips &/or discover new features (I found at least 20); and 2) Assess the entirety of the course so that I could recommend it to friends/colleagues who have very basic Excel knowledge. Very good course.
results.content_html: I am actually quite well versed in Excel but decided to start with the beginners portion of the course for 2 reasons: 1) I could listen along while I work to pick up tips &/or discover new features (I found at least 20); and 2) Assess the entirety of the course so that I could recommend it to friends/colleagues who have very basic Excel knowledge. Very good course.

results.content: I found the lectures easy to understand even with the British accent.  Simon's speech patterns enhanced my understanding of the lecture material.  I have signed up for his Office 2013 courses because I know I will enjoy and understand the information given.
results.content_html: I found the lectures easy to understand even with the British accent. Simon's speech patterns enhanced my understanding of the lecture material. I have signed up for his Office 2013 courses because I know I will enjoy and understand the information given.

results.content:
Excellent course. I first took the Simon Sez IT MS Project 2013 Bundle and really enjoyed the course. I learned a great deal from it. Since I liked it so much I decided to try the MS Excel 2013 course. I was quite pleased to find that Toby Arnott was the instructor again as he did a fantastic job with the Project courses. A couple of things to note with this course... 
I have more experience with Excel than I had with Project so much (though by no means all) of what is in the Beginner course is review. Fortunately the Udemy interface allows me to play it at 2x speed to get through it quicker without missing anything interesting. Your brain gets used to the speed pretty quickly and before you know it you don't even notice that it is faster than normal. Similarly, since all MS Office products share the ribbon interface and Office Backstage, most of that is similar to what I saw in the MS Project course. If you are taking several MS Office courses you will see some redundancy but you can speed past it or use it as review. 
As I got into the advanced portion of the course I found that it went beyond what I typically need to use Excel for. While I need to be able to use some other products such as MS Project or MS OneNote at an advanced level, I’m probably fine with using Excel at an intermediate level. I’m not a statistician or a finance and accounting guy and some of the material was interesting but not something I will typically use in my daily job. That said, for those who need that, I think it was covered well. I recommend the course.
results.content_html:

results.content: Excellent coverage of most common uses of Excel and instructor is engaging  and clearly an expert in Excel.

results.content: It's been a great course. I been able learn when my schedule allows.

results.content: Thorough on many topics though covering ALL of advanced excel is out of range for anyone, much was covered.
